title: Digital Marketing and Communications Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Dallas
Interview Descriptions: Very easy, spoke to manager for 15 minutes, answered questions about my resume, related to his experience as an alumni, incredibly simple process, the interview was in person not online
Interview Questions: What relevant skills do you have?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Dallas
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by two of my supervisors. They asked about my customer service experience and make sure I was a good fit for the work. They also ask some practical questions to see if I can work under the stress
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself ? What is your strength?

title: Columnist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Dallas
Interview Descriptions: You just submit things that you wrote. You have to be a halfway decent writer but it’s not that hard to get published as long as you put in a respectable effort.
Interview Questions: They don’t really ask questions. You’re just submitting written work.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Dallas
Interview Descriptions: Incredibly disorganized- committee members were incredibly rude- was given a list of questions ahead of time they would be asking- they asked none of them. At least a dozen illegal questions asked, and reference made to 10 year old "Rate Your Professor" reviews. Awful.
Interview Questions: Do you think you might be too liberal to work here?

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Dallas (Dallas, TX) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Asked a series of questions by three current employees for formal interview, then did a presentation for all the staff on something you're passionate about, ended with getting to chat with all current employees.
Interview Questions: What your dream career is and where you see yourself in the future

title: Advancement Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Dallas
Interview Descriptions: Typical interview, simple process but very delayed response time from HR. The hiring manager was motivated to hire but HR was the slowdown on their end. It took about two months for the process to conclude.
Interview Questions: Asked about why I was interested in the position

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Dallas
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, got called for an interview on site. Everyone was friendly and explained in detail the job duties. Was asked about previous work experience. Got an offer and accepted it!
Interview Questions: What experience do you have

title: Lead Telerecruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Dallas (Dallas, TX) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: There was a panel of three interviewers, who were all admissions counselors, who asked questions for approximately 30 minutes. The interview was conducted in the admissions office for the school.
Interview Questions: How would you handle workplace conflicts?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Dallas
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to meet the department head who asked me questions related to my background and the role of the person who would be hired. She asked me questions about my previous administrative role.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Dallas (Irving, TX) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was good based on your previous working skills and the undergraduate course. You need to be extra hardworking for the desired position. It is basically about the student help they need mostly in the summers or the college maintenance work. Interview was all about you can contribute to the facilities department of college.
Interview Questions: How you can contribute to their company

title: Fund Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Dallas (Irving, TX) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Don't worry about it. Your school education speaks for itself. As long as you have a solid GPa your good to go so just keep on keeping on and you will get the job.
Interview Questions: Please tell me what the definition of Free cash flow is?

title: Student Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Dallas (Irving, TX) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Short, 30 min, basic questions about the school, student life. It was meeting with some member s of the admission staff and the head of admissions. questions varied, they ask about your college selection process and how that would be applicable when speaking with a prospective student.
Interview Questions: What is a liberal arts education?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Dallas (Irving, TX) in Jun 2009
Interview Descriptions: All went well. Was treated well by professional staff. Was welcomed and enjoyed lunch with staff representatives.
Interview Questions: Why do you want the position?
